column2: JPage, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had been coughing for almost 2 weeks along with a bad head cold. My cough was a dry cough. I saw results in 2 days. I completely stopped coughing after about 4-5 days. Wonderful experience with this medication. Would definitely recommend it to someone with what I had.

column2: m0lleybr0wn, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I hace COPD along with one bad lung. I had the flu and took this for the first time. It work like a charm. I'ce been sleeping all night if taking properly. Very easy to swallow and I will use these again if needed. I've had a cough for over 4 years. WORKED GREAT!

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Didn't work for me.  Had to go back and get another medication

column2: BamaBronchial, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had been aggravated for 3-4 weeks with leftover cough from bronchitis.  Lortab elixir worked v. good.  OTC cough relief medications (eg-theraflu, cough syrups, etc) were only marginally effective and were absolutely vile to take orally.  Went back to Lortab elixir, worked v. good.  Then back to OTC, not great and just plain nasty.  Dr. then prescribed Tessalon as cough was still persisting.  May as well have prescribed sugar pills.  I believe I could have likely taken the whole dang bottle without any ill effects.  Waste of money.  Lortab elixir was less $$ and far more effective.  I'll never let him prescribe this crap for me again.  May work for you, but did absolutely nothing but take my money.  Total waste.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Medication did not effectively treat cough. May have caused mild bronchospasm causing increased coughing epidoses.

column2: RandiZ, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a persistent cough which was getting worse in severity and the number of coughing fits.  After 2 weeks during which antibiotics and cough syrup with codine didn't help, my dr. prescribed tessalon bedes.  It really helped supress the cough to the point that I could work during the day.  It turned out that I had whooping cough which is starting to clear up four weeks later.  The only warning I would give is that I had some insanely strange dreams, and i normally don't dream at all.

column2: just deb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Ari's Mom, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It definitely stopped the cough but taking it at night caused me to sleep like the dead and wake up feeling dizzy and queezy.  I also had terrifying nightmares and even a feeling of  smothered. I also had taken Claritin so maybe the two caused the side effects. I did read that it's not to be taken with an antihistamine, I wish I'd been more careful and not self-medicated the additional Claritin.  I should have checked with the pharmicist first.  I've only taken two doses and I think I'll go back to the cough syrup.  I am going to call the pharmacist...a little proactive too late!  Shame on me.

column2: Ke', 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I've taken it before but earlier in the day so I did not notice the hyper effect. but the fact that i took 2 ativan AND a 0.5 xanax and im still wide awake all I can think is this drug made me hyper. can someone let me know if has happend to anyone else?

column2: bobeckie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: In response to the woman who needed a cheaper med. - this (Tessalon Perle) is available as a generic, not OTC, but generic by the name Benzonatate through Wal Mart.  It was about $15.00 for 30.

column2: betc, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have chronic bronchitis and took this Rx for 2 years before I took early retirement in 2007. Since I would not be 65 until 2009, I had to discontinue due to no insurance.  Now my Medicare provider will not approve this Rx.  Does anyone know of another similar drug.  I cannot take otc meds due to reactions to the ingredient used to stop cough.  Please can anyone make a suggestion.

column2: clark2, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
bflogal122, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I am writing this as a warning to others.  My 19yr. old Grandaughter recently went to the emergecy room with what turned out to be an Upper Respiratory Infection.  While there she was given Tessalon Perle by one of the nurses and told to let it dissolve on her tongue.  After she did this, she complained that her tongue was numb and her throat felt numb too.  Fortunately the numbness went away quickly but we have since found out for several pharmacist and from WebMD that this medication is ONLY to be SWALLEWED and never dissolved in the mouth!  Be very careful folks about what you are given in the ER.

column2: monaellen85, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had bronchitis, I have been given this drug before and it worked, but this time it has not worked at all.

column2: paneltroll, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have used this drug 3 times in many years.  The first time I had a cough so bad that I had to go to the ER for treatment and they only gave me cough syrup.  I went to a reg. Dr. the next day and he gave me this med. and I was so relieved and it finally calmed my cough.  The second time I used this for the same cough and it didn't seem to work, only an antibiotic would help me this time.  This last time I thought yeah I would try them again because I had not slept in a week and my sides and back hurt so bad just from coughing, and it worked like a miracle this time.  I don't think the symptoms were different in any of these cases but maybe they were.

column2: englteach,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After three weeks of horrible hacking cough, during which I could barely breathe or sleep, I was diagnosed with whooping cough and was given this to treat the cough that was not being helped by the codine cough syrup.  These calmed the cough and allowed me to sleep for the first time in three weeks.  Now, because of a bad persistant cough, I never want to be without my Perles.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: dabadabadoo, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After sever weks of sever cough due to bronchitis, which my doctor treated with robitussin ac, Which helped me sleep through the night and function during the day. I missed no days of work. But he switched to this med. Like other physicians he seems afraid to use what was working for fear of addiction. Now I hack all day even when I take the med which has me jittery and weird.

column2: miagrrl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: my doctor prescribed me this, in place of hycodan - since i wanted to try a non-narcotic cough suppressent. it works very well, with no side effects. i can take it day or night, it will not make me sleepy. it works fast (within 20-30 minutes). calms my lungs down quickly. its not a miracle drug, but its definately better than otc medications.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started with a mild cough and after starting the tessalon it got worse. I started coughing a lot during the day. At night, the cough became persistant. After four days of not sleeping, waiting for the drug to work, I switched back to my Robotussin and slept like an angel!

column2: Healthylife723, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was taking this drug for about 4 days and then had to discontinue use because it made me very itchy.

column2: grandma, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a nagging, non-productive cough at the end of a bad cold.  At night I coughed until nearly gagging.  This Rx completely relieved the cough almost immediately.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: TexasGramma, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have COPD Asthma/Bhronchitis plus lung scar tissue. The only thing I ever found to really help me is the Hycodan Compound cough syrup.The problem with this is the FDA is overeacting to celebraties that are using this with other illegal drugs and killing themselves...so the rest of us have to suffer. I have also tried the inhalers...but they are ineffective too....Any one else have any suggestions?PS I have never in my life done ANY illegal drugs of been addicted to medications. column2: iqeverything, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I get frequent upper respiratory infections and when my coughing interupts my sleep this is the only medicine that is effective at stopping the cough and allows me to rest.  It starts working in like 15 minutes and allows for a cough-free night.  I would suggest taking it during the day for the first time so you know how you will react to it.  You MUST take it with at least one full glass of water or you will wake up with an extremely dry throat and nasal passage.  It really does work extremely well.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it is better then cough surup but makes you a bit goofy! It doesn't make you sleepy or give you an awful feeling when coming off of it.
